author: Staff Reporter
text:
A burglary attempt by unidentified persons at People’s Cooperative Bank at the busy Veppamudu junction here on Thursday midnight was foiled by the 60-year-old watchman.

Thiraviyam (60) of Pudukiramam village was the night duty watchman at the bank. It was said that the burglars broke open the lock of one of the three gates, while the watchman was sitting near the main gate on the roadside.

On hearing some noise, Mr. Thiraviyam went to the side gate and found that a few persons were breaking the gate with iron rods. When Mr. Thiraviyam raised an alarm, the burglars attacked him, inflicting a severe injury on him and escaped from the place.

Mr. Thiraviyam immediately alerted District Police Office (DPO). Police personnel rushed to the bank and shifted Mr. Thiraviyam to Kanyakumari Government Medical College Hospital.

Forensic experts visited the spot and lifted fingerprints of the burglars. Superintendent of Police G. Dharmarajan rushed to the spot and conducted an inquiry.

Based on a complaint lodged by the bank, Kottar police have registered a case.
title: 60-year-old watchman thwarts burglary at bank
